definition: decoration/ornament/to decorate/to adorn/to hide/to conceal (a fault)/excuse (to hide a fault)/to play a role (in opera)/to impersonate

sentences.english: The embossment requires at least 500 skill in Leatherworking to remain active.
sentences.chinese: 雕飾需要至少500點制皮技能才能生效。

sentences.english: There you can rent such a carved house for quite an adequate price.
sentences.chinese: 在這裏，你可以很經濟地租用到雕飾精美的屋子。

sentences.english: As in the gold mosaic of a wall.
sentences.chinese: 好像是壁畫上嵌金的雕飾。

sentences.english: You are naked, but it feels natural, a sense of unrefinedfreedom.
sentences.chinese: 你赤裸着，但卻感到自然，有種不加雕飾的自由之感。

sentences.english: However, Because of the excessive sculpture, he gently drew the bow, and it broke.
sentences.chinese: 但是，這張弓因爲雕飾過度，輕輕一拉就斷了。

sentences.english: Embossing your bracers causes them to become soulbound.
sentences.chinese: 爲護腕附上雕飾將使它變成靈魂綁定。

sentences.english: There are striated engravings on this wall.
sentences.chinese: 這面牆上有着條紋狀的雕飾。

definition: to resemble nature itself/of the highest quality (idiom)
original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
